rename.to: ConnectionError in spider not handled gracefully

body:
That answer is from ZAP itself, which seems to be caused by missing API key (more information in: <https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/wiki/FAQapikey>), you can pass the API key when creating the `ZAPv2` object:
```Python
zap = ZAPv2(proxies={'http': 'http://' + zap_ip + ':' + str(port), 'https': 'http://' + zap_ip + ':' + str(port)}, apikey='ApiKey')
```
but you need to set it when starting ZAP (either that or disable the API key).
Ah my mistake :). Update must've set ik back to default settings causing it to be re-enabled. The error's not very informative, is it?
Its deliberately not very informative I'm afraid - more useful error messages could be used by sites to detect the fact that ZAPs being used ;)
Note that you can always check in the logs why ZAP didn't answer (e.g. in this case using `docker logs` command).

In the logs, this is the error i'm getting. Should i maybe open a new issue for this, for clarity's sake?


69911 [ZAP-ProxyThread-60] WARN org.zaproxy.zap.extension.api.API  - Request to API URL http://zap/JSON/core/view/version/ from 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 not permitted

OK, I assumed that the problem was the API key (that's the most common issue).

We can use this issue, we should have that address allowed by default (like we have localhost/127.0.0.1). In the meantime you can add that address to the list of allowed addresses (the config keys are also mentioned in the FAQ linked previously).

rename.from: ConnectionError in spider not handled gracefully
rename.to: Allow IPv6 loopback address to access the API by default

body:
Thank you kindly for reopening the issue, glad i can contribute somewhat :)
I've added api.addrs.addr.name=0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 to the config, however now it fails on this:

`Request to API URL http://zap/JSON/core/view/version/ with host header zap not permitted`

At https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/zaproxy-jenkins/PJBysyheHdw I see you mention this as a bug in the weekly of march 20th, I can't seem to find much info on resolving it elsewhere. How might i go about this? Thanks ever so much in advance.

Right, sorry, just adding that overrides the whole list of allowed addresses, you need something like:
`-config api.addrs.addr(0).name=0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 -config api.addrs.addr(1).name=zap -config api.addrs.addr(2).name=localhost -config api.addrs.addr(3).name=127.0.0.1`

We need to update that FAQ entry to refer to https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/wiki/FAQconfigValues

issue.title: Add IPv6 loopback to default API allowed addresses

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change OptionsParamApi to include the IPv6 loopback address when adding
the default addresses that can access the API. Also, replace literal
"zap" address with the constant.

Fix #3836 - Allow IPv6 loopback address to access the API by default

issue.title: localhost IPv6 is not in the whitelisted IPs by default

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body: After adding `0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1` to the whitelist, I was able to browse the API UI from a browser. As it is the same as `localhost` and `127.0.0.1` already whitelisted, I think it makes sense to whitelist also this IP by default.

body: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
